@description.name: @description
@description.body: A button which acts as a normal button and shows a menu on one of the sides to open something like a history list.

@childControl.name: @childControl
@childControl.body: arrow {qx.ui.form.MenuButton} arrow to open the popup

@param.name: @param
@param.body: command {qx.ui.command.Command} Command instance to connect with

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Configure the visibility of the sub elements/widgets. Possible values: both, text, icon

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The menu instance to show when tapping on the button

@description.name: @description
@description.body: overridden

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
id {String} ID of the child control. If a # is used, the id is
   the part in front of the #.
@param.description:
ID of the child control. If a # is used, the id is
   the part in front of the #.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
hash {String?undefined} If a child control name contains a #,
   all text following the # will be the hash argument.
